source.f45539fa:
#  Overview Tab:
                          1.It gives us the general overview of the data,that is Number of features,number of           records,duplicate rows.It also gives the number of numerical,categorical feature and boolean features.
                          
                          2.Reproduction: It gives the time when the analysis started and finished and current version.
                          
                          3.Warnings:It gives the features with high cardinality(High cardinality means a lot of unique values ( a large k). A column with hundreds of zip codes is an example of a high cardinality feature),missing values and zeros
source.aa487408:
# Correlation tab:
                        This is used to check the correlation of variables.It offers several correlation methods like
                        1.Pearsons correlation.
                        2.Spearmans correlation.
                        3.Kendalls correlation.
                        4.Cramers correlation.

                          It is used to see the bivarient analysis between two variables.

source.b3950443:
# Variables tab:
            It gives the entire information of the variables like 
                Distinct values count,
                Missing values count and percentage,
                Count and percentages of infinity values,zeros values,
                Mean,minimum and maximum,
                Finally the distribution of the variable.

source.84b149d0: Profiling is a process that helps us in understanding our data and PandasProfiling is python package which does exactly that. It is a simple and fast way to perform exploratory data analysis of a Pandas Dataframe. The pandasdf.describe() and df.info() functions are normally used as a first step in the EDA process. However, it only gives a very basic overview of the data and doesn’t help much in the case of large data sets. The Pandas Profiling function, on the other hand, extends the pandas DataFrame withdf.profile_report() for quick data analysis. It displays a lot of information with a single line of code and that too in an interactive HTML report.
source.3c884f03: I commented the line,You can run it in jupiter notebook and the html file "Htmlfile.html" will be present in your desired folder.

# Missing values tab:
                                    It gives the visualisation of missing values of all the features.The following are the various types of visualization:
                                    1.By representing count of missing values using bar graphs.
                                    2.Matrix format.
                                    3.Dendogram.
                                    4.Heatmap
